input_text.Prompt:
Conversation:
Jennifer: What's wrong with you? Why are you scratching so much?
Deenah: I feel itchy! I can't stand it anymore! I think I may be coming down with something. I feel lightheaded and weak.
Jennifer: Let me have a look. Whoa! Get away from me!
Deenah: What's wrong?
Jennifer: I think you have chicken pox! You are contagious! Get away! Don't breathe on me!
Deenah: Maybe it's just a rash or an allergy! We can't be sure until I see a doctor.
Jennifer: Well in the meantime you are a biohazard! I didn't get it when I was a kid and I've heard that you can even die if you get it as an adult!
Deenah: Are you serious? You always blow things out of proportion. In any case, I think I'll go take an oatmeal bath.

Now write a summary of the conversation:
input_text.Response A: Deenah feels itchy. Jennifer doubts it is chicken pox and asks Deenah to get away. Deenah doesn't believe it.
input_text.Response B: Deenah feels itchy and thinks she may be coming down with something. Jennifer thinks Deenah has chicken pox and is contagious. Deenah goes to take an oatmeal bath.

label_annotations.factors_a: Response A is slightly factually incorrect. Jennifer thinks it IS chicken pox, not doubts that it is.
label_annotations.factors_b: Response B seems accurate and had a good summary overall.
label_annotations.feedback: B is much better and more correct than A
